revision.comment: Czalex moved page [[Talk:Byelorussian partisans]] to [[Talk:Belarusian partisans]] over redirect: Belarus is the commonly accepted modern name for the country and its territory, including in reference to pre-1991
revision.text:
{{WPMILHIST|class=Start |B1 <!-- Referencing and citations -->=n |B2 <!-- Coverage and accuracy -->=n |B3 <!-- Structure -->=y |B4 <!-- Grammar and style -->=y |B5 <!-- Supporting materials -->=y |WWII=yes}} ==Image copyright problem with File:Soviet partisan movement activities overview 1941-1944.jpg== The image [[:File:Soviet partisan movement activities overview 1941-1944.jpg]] is used in this article under a claim of [[WP:NFC|fair use]], but it does not have an adequate explanation for why it meets the [[WP:NFCC|requirements for such images]] when used here. In particular, for each page the image is used on, it must have an [[Wikipedia:Non-free use rationale guideline|explanation]] linking to that page which explains why it needs to be used on that page. Please check
:* That there is a [[Wikipedia:Non-free use rationale guideline|non-free use rationale]] on the image's description page for the use in this article. :* That this article is linked to from the image description page. <!-- Additional 10c list header goes here -->
This is an automated notice by [[User:FairuseBot|FairuseBot]]. For assistance on the image use policy, see [[Wikipedia:Media copyright questions]]. --10:24, 5 March 2009 (UTC)
== [[Belarusian resistance during World War II]] ==
Shouldn't the two articles be integrated?[[User:Xx236|Xx236]] ([[User talk:Xx236|talk]]) 12:48, 1 December 2012 (UTC) : I’m agree they are about the same. --[[User:Renessaince|Renessaince]] ([[User talk:Renessaince|talk]]) 08:21, 4 August 2014 (UTC) :: Agreed, but personally I prefer the broader scope of the "resistance" title. This article should be a section of it.—''[[User:Brigade Piron|Brigade Piron]]'' ([[User talk:Brigade Piron|talk]]) 11:11, 10 February 2016 (UTC) :::Agree that this article should be a section of [[Belarusian resistance during World War II]]. [[User:K.e.coffman|K.e.coffman]] ([[User talk:K.e.coffman|talk]]) 00:34, 14 February 2016 (UTC) :Both articles rely heavily on the history of Soviet partisans deployed and supplied from Moscow along with the Red Army. The actual historically ''distinguishable'' Belarusian anti-Nazi resistance and/or partisans did not play a role in the territory of [[Soviet Belarus]], [[Belarusian Home Defence]] did. Both articles could easily be cut in half, because both speak in half-truths. '''<font color="darkblue" face="Papyrus">[[User:Poeticbent|Poeticbent]]</font>''' <font style="color:#FFFFFF;font-size:7.0pt;font-weight:bold;background:#FF88AF;border:1px solid #DF2929;padding:0.0em 0.2em;">[[User_talk:Poeticbent|talk]]</font> 05:52, 14 February 2016 (UTC) :I don't understand your point? —''[[User:Brigade Piron|Brigade Piron]]'' ([[User talk:Brigade Piron|talk]]) 18:45, 14 February 2016 (UTC) ::Would you please elaborate on that? What point do you mean? [[Byelorussian collaboration with the Axis powers]] was an official policy of the Byelorussian government. [[Soviet partisans]] however have their own article in Wikipedia. This article needs to be trimmed because it [[WP:SYNTH|combines material from Soviet sources]] to support a ''subject-specific'' article which is not their subject. Thanks for asking, '''<font color="darkblue" face="Papyrus">[[User:Poeticbent|Poeticbent]]</font>''' <font style="color:#FFFFFF;font-size:7.0pt;font-weight:bold;background:#FF88AF;border:1px solid #DF2929;padding:0.0em 0.2em;">[[User_talk:Poeticbent|talk]]</font> 21:39, 14 February 2016 (UTC) :::So you are saying that the [[Bielski partisans]], for example, were not Byelorussian? —''[[User:Brigade Piron|Brigade Piron]]'' ([[User talk:Brigade Piron|talk]]) 14:31, 9 March 2016 (UTC)
